elements.title: Susanna Hoffs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Susanna Hoffs (pictured) sang on the studio recording of "Eternal Flame" naked after producer Davitt Sigerson pranked her by saying that Olivia Newton-John had done the same thing?

elements.title: On the German Republic (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Mann insisted on omitting a passage on homoeroticism in the English translation of his work "On the German Republic"?

elements.title: Cruise of the Kings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than 100 European royals boarded the Cruise of the Kings, a 1954 cruise organised by the Greek queen consort Frederica of Hanover to promote tourism in Greece?

elements.title: Le Moniteur Acadien (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first Acadian newspaper, Le Moniteur Acadien, was acquired in 2023 for just CA$1?

elements.title: NCVs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that NCVs can assign different values to the lives of civilians of different nationalities?

elements.title: My Beautiful Man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yuu Nagira, the author of My Beautiful Man, did not expect readers to love one of the main characters because she had written him to be creepy?

elements.title: Agnes Mapes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Agnes Mapes had to improvise a complex choreographed dance from basic poses for the 1907 play The Holy City?

elements.title: Sonja van den Ende (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in March 2022 Sonja van den Ende was the only Dutch journalist to report from the Russian-occupied Donbas on the war in Ukraine?

elements.title: a Thai hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a restaurant in a Thai hotel serves "Chicken Volcano", a dish containing whiskey?
